csc171.project02.controller

Class BankController

  • java.lang.Object
    • csc171.project02.controller.BankController

  • public class BankController
extends java.lang.Object
    The BankController is a controller layer than abstracts out interaction with the Bank and related model objects. On first interaction, the BankController can either authenticate a customer or create a new customer. In any case, the customer must be instantiated before any other actions take place. Once a customer reference exists, there also needs to be an active account on which further actions are performed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BankController(Bank bank)
      Sets up a new BankController to allow interaction with the Bank Model

    • Constructor Detail

      • BankController

        public BankController(Bank bank)
        Sets up a new BankController to allow interaction with the Bank Model
        Parameters:
        bank - is the Bank to set the Controller to interface with. Must be created elsewhere and supplied to the controller, as the controller is blind to the creation logic. In fact, the Bank constructor is package-private, and thus must be instantiated from within the model package (use the BankFactory).

    • Method Detail

      • getBankController

        public static BankController getBankController()
        This static method creates an instance of this class with a Bank from the BankFactory It is not necessary to get the Controllor using this method, but is useful for testing when a persistent Bank model does not exist.
        Returns:
        an instance of the BankController with a Bank from the BankFactory supplied for it to interface with

      • getBankName

        public java.lang.String getBankName()
        This method returns the name of the Bank active in the Controller
        Returns:
        the name of the Bank

      • createCustomer

        public void createCustomer(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password,
                           java.lang.String firstName,
                           java.lang.String lastName,
                           java.util.Date birthdate)
        This method creates a new Customer (if the username does not yet exist) and then marks that Customer as active so that further actions may be performed with that Customer
        Parameters:
        username - is the username to create the Customer with
        password - is the password to create the Customer with
        firstName - is the first name of the Customer
        lastName - is the last name of the Customer
        birthdate - is the birthdate of the Customer

        This method authenticates the Controller with a Customer marks that Customer as active for further actions to be performed with that Customer
        Parameters:
        username - is the username to attempt to authenticate
        password - is the password to attempt to authenticate
